==== Ubuntu 20.10 (Groovy Gorilla) End of Life reached on July 22 2021 ====

Brian Murray, on behalf of the Ubuntu Release Team, confirms that Ubuntu 20.10 is End of Life and is no longer supported. Upgrade instructions and supporting links are provided.

https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/ubuntu-announce/2021-July/000270.html

=== In the Blogosphere ===

==== Plasma Mobile 21.07 Released with Improvements for Kasts, Dialer, Shell, and More ====

Marius Nestor tells us the KDE Project has announced the release of Plasma Mobile 21.07, and provides us with details of many of the improvements contained therein. A link is provided to the release announcement, and suggests if we're using Plasma Mobile, that we update asap to enjoy the benefits of this upgrade.

https://9to5linux.com/plasma-mobile-21-07-released-with-improvements-for-kasts-dialer-shell-and-more

==== VirtualBox 6.1.24 Released with Support for Linux 5.13 and Ubuntu Specific Kernels ====

Marius Nestor informs us of Oracle's release of Virtual``Box 6.1.24, with support for the Linux 5.13 kernel series. A few Linux host fixes are mentioned, as well as other all-platform fixes, and a Solaris guest fix. A link is provided to the official website.

https://9to5linux.com/virtualbox-6-1-24-released-with-support-for-linux-5-13-and-ubuntu-specific-kernels

==== Canonical Pushes New Ubuntu Kernel Updates to All Supported Releases ====

Marius Nestor alerts us that Canonical have released Linux kernel updates for all supported Ubuntu releases that fix many security vulnerabilities. Listing the releases (which include 16.04 & 14.04 ESM) we are then provided a summary of the releases impacted and the CVEs fixed. Presented is how they could be mis-used, and why we should upgrade our systems asap.

https://9to5linux.com/canonical-pushes-new-ubuntu-kernel-updates-to-all-supported-releases

Amplifying info:
* Sequoia: A Local Privilege Escalation Vulnerability in Linux‚Äôs Filesystem Layer (CVE-2021-33909) - https://blog.qualys.com/vulnerabilities-threat-research/2021/07/20/sequoia-a-local-privilege-escalation-vulnerability-in-linuxs-filesystem-layer-cve-2021-33909

==== Ubuntu 20.10 ‚ÄúGroovy Gorilla‚Äù Reached End of Life, Upgrade to Ubuntu 21.04 Now ====

Marius Nestor reminds us that Ubuntu 20.10 "Groovy Gorilla" reached its end-of-life on 22 July 2021. Marius reminds us briefly of what Ubuntu 20.10 provided, and suggests that any of us who have not yet upgraded from 20.10 do so asap.

https://9to5linux.com/ubuntu-20-10-groovy-gorilla-reached-end-of-life-upgrade-to-ubuntu-21-04-now

=== Get Involved ===

The Ubuntu community consists of individuals and teams, working on different aspects of the distribution, giving advice and technical support, and helping to promote Ubuntu to a wider audience. No contribution is too small, and anyone can help. It's your chance to get in on all the community fun associated with developing and promoting Ubuntu. More on this at: https://community.ubuntu.com/contribute/

Or get involved with the Ubuntu Weekly Newsletter team! We always need summary writers and editors, if you're interested, learn more at: https://wiki.ubuntu.com/UbuntuWeeklyNewsletter/Join

=== Feedback ===

This document is maintained by the Ubuntu Weekly News Team. If you have a story idea or suggestions for the Weekly Newsletter, join the Ubuntu News Team mailing list at https://lists.ubuntu.com/mailman/listinfo/Ubuntu-news-team and submit it. Ideas can also be added to the wiki at https://wiki.ubuntu.com/UbuntuWeeklyNewsletter/Ideas. If you'd like to contribute to a future issue of the Ubuntu Weekly Newsletter, please feel free to edit the appropriate wiki page. If you have any technical support questions, please check https://community.ubuntu.com/help-information/ for more information on where to get help.
